absenceExceptions.name: Absence Exceptions
absenceExceptions.description: The Absence Exceptions entity provides the data columns that that indicate when an employee has had an Excused Absence or Unexcused Absence exception during the selected time period. The data columns return a True or False value to indicate if the exception has occurred. A True value is rendered as a check mark and a False value as an empty cell.
absenceExceptions.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee for the defined time period

columns.label: Excused Absence Indicator
columns.description: Indicates if the employee has had an excused absence exception during the selected time period.

columns.label: Unexcused Absence Indicator
columns.description: Indicates if the employee has had an unexcused absence exception during the selected time period.

accrualBalancesByDay.name: Accrual Balances by Day
accrualBalancesByDay.description: The Accrual Balances by Day entity allows an administrator to create a Dataview or report data object that lists accrual balances for all accrual codes or for a selected accrual code. The Accrual Balances by Day entity is a replica of the Accrual Daily Balances entity but, instead of providing the balance data as of the end date of the defined time period, the Accrual Balances by Day entity provides the balance data for each day in the selected time period.
accrualBalancesByDay.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per accrual code per date.

accrualCode.name: Accrual Code
accrualCode.description: Use the Accrual Code entity to create Dataviews and reports that include accrual balances and transactions. It provides the data columns that display the accrual code related to a balance or transaction, as well as all of the attributes of that accrual code, such as its name and type (hours, money, or day).

accrualDailyBalances.name: Accrual Daily Balances
accrualDailyBalances.description: The Accrual Daily Balances entity provides the available, vested, and probationary accrual balances for each unique employee and accrual code combination. This information includes the current available accrual balance which factors in future planned takings. In addition, the Accrual Daily Balances entity provides data columns that show the accruals that the employee has earned to date and taken to date, as well as its pending grants and planned takings.
accrualDailyBalances.dataGranularity: Provides one row per accrual code and employee for the defined time period.

accrualReportingPeriodBalances.name: Accrual Reporting Period Balances
accrualReportingPeriodBalances.description: The Accrual Reporting Period Balances entity provides accrual balance data based on the defined accrual reporting period for each defined accrual code. This information includes the vested and probationary balances for the beginning and end of the accrual reporting period that is associated with the accrual code, including the ending balance for the previous reporting period.

accrualTransactions.name: Accrual Transactions
accrualTransactions.description: The Accrual Transactions entity provides data for all accrual transactions by employee, accrual code, and accrual transaction type (such as takings, grants, and probation period start).

additionalInfo: The Accrual Code entity is not used with the Accrual Transactions entity. The Accrual Transactions entity provides the Accrual Code data columns necessary for transaction-level reporting.

When building a Dataview using the Accrual Transactions entity, be sure to include the Employee Name, Accrual Code Name, Accrual Transaction Type, and Effective Date data columns to ensure that the transactional data that is returned includes all of the information that is needed to make it useable.

Do not use the Accrual Transactions entity with the Accrual Daily Balances and Accrual Reporting Period Balances entities. These entities are not related because they return data at different granularities. The combination of these entities is only possible if the column relationship rules are disabled. If they are used together, rows are returned that provide Accrual Transactions data plus separate rows that provide accrual balance data, with no clear relationship other than the associated Accrual Code.

activity.name: Activity

It contains a large number of properties that fully describe the activity definition and contain status information. All activity status attributes are available in this entity. Select the Activity entity after any of the transactional Activity entities in order to view the values selected from their data attribute columns.

activityEfficiency.name: Activity Efficiency
description: The Activity Segment Efficiency entity shows the efficiency of the activity segment based on the allocated, earned hours and quantity. Two types of efficiency are calculated.
If the efficiency type = 0, the entity represents the efficiency of the activity segment as a whole.

If the efficiency type = 1, the entity shows the efficiency each time that a new quantity is added for the activity segment. This allows users to track the efficiency over the full duration of the activity segment.
activityEfficiency.dataGranularity: When the efficiency type = SEGMENT (0), the Activity Segment Efficiency entity provides one efficiency value per activity segment row. When the efficiency type = SUBSEGMENT (1), it provides many efficiency values to one activity sub-segment rows. The number of sub-segment rows reflects the number of times for which quantity results were reported.

activityFailedForms.name: Activity Failed Forms
description: The Activity Failed Forms entity records failed transactions from clocks during their offline mode.

When clocks lose connectivity to the server, this entity continues to record all activity transactions at the clock without interaction with the server. When the clock regains connectivity, the clock sends all of the saved transactions to the server. Any errors that prevent the activity from being stored in the main table can be viewed in this entity.
activityFailedForms.dataGranularity: Provides multiple rows per Activity Segment and Employee for the defined time period because there may be multiple results associated with this activity segment and employee for the defined time period.

activityTransactions.name: Activity Transactions
activityTransactions.description: The Activity Transactions entity represents the activity on which each employee worked. The activity itself is referenced in the Activity entity. The activity transaction, or activity segment, represents both the hourly and duration types of employee activities. Any reported result for the segment, such as quantity completed, is also provided in the Activity Transactions entity.

actualScheduleShiftTimes.name: Actual & Schedule Shift Times
description: The Actual & Schedule Shift Times entity allows users to create a Dataview or report that lists the actual and scheduled punch times for all shifts for all employees returned as a single row for each shift assigned to an employee.
The Actual Shift Start and Actual Shift End columns will include projected punches for Pay From Schedule employees.
actualScheduleShiftTimes.dataGranularity: Provides one row for each punch time for each shift per employee.

actualPaycodeTotalsCorrectionsOnly.name: Actual Paycode Totals - Corrections Only
description: The Actual Paycode Totals Corrections Only provides the total hours, wages, or days related to a historical correction made during the selected time period for a selected pay code.

When creating a Dataview, you can select the pay code for which totals data will be provided. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the hours for each employee that are related to the 'REGULAR' pay code and that were generated by a historical correction performed in the selected time period, configure the Paycode Total Actual Hours (Corrections Only) data column with an assignment value of 'REGULAR.'
actualPaycodeTotalsCorrectionsOnly.dataGranularity: Provides one row per Employee. The data that is returned is summarized for the selected time period.

columns.label: Paycode Total Actual Days (Corrections Only)
columns.description: Returns the day totals for the assigned paycode summed for the timeframe. Note that this column populates a total only for day-type paycodes that were generated by a historical correction and were included in totals.

columns.label: Paycode Total Actual Hours (Corrections Only)
columns.description: Returns the hour totals for the assigned paycode summed for the timeframe. Note that this column populates a total only for hour-type paycodes that were generated by a historical correction and were included in totals.

columns.label: Paycode Total Actual Wages (Corrections Only)
columns.description: Returns the wage totals for the assigned paycode summed for the timeframe. Note that this column populates a total only for hour or wage paycodes that were generated by a historical correction, included in totals, and have a monetary amount associated with them.

additionalInfo: When using the data columns in the Actual Paycode Totals Corrections Only entity, select the desired pay code from all available pay codes, including both Standard and Combined pay codes.

When creating a Dataview, you can add the same data column from the Actual Paycode Totals Corrections Only entity multiple times, assigning a different pay code to each. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the actual hours that are related to the 'REGULAR' pay code and the 'OVERTIME' pay code, you can add the Paycode Total Actual Hours (Corrections Only) data column twice, assigning the 'REGULAR' pay code to one column and the 'OVERTIME' pay code to the other.

You can use the data columns in the Actual Paycode Totals Corrections Only entity in conjunction with the data columns in the Projected Paycode Totals Corrections Only and the Scheduled Paycode Totals entities to view a comparison of Actual to Projected to Scheduled. To do this, you must disable the Column Relationship Rules in the Dataview and assign the same pay code to the selected data columns in these entities.

actualPaycodeTotalsExcludeCorrections.name: Actual Paycode Totals - Exclude Corrections
actualPaycodeTotalsExcludeCorrections.description: The Actual Paycode Totals Exclude Corrections entity provides the total hours, wages, or days that are related to the selected time period for a selected pay code, minus any historical correction totals related to the selected time period. When creating a Dataview, you can select the pay code for which totals data will be provided. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the hours for each employee that are related to the 'REGULAR' pay code that apply to the selected time period (excluding historical corrections made in that period), configure the Paycode Total Actual Hours (Exclude Corrections) data column with an assignment value of 'REGULAR'.
actualPaycodeTotalsExcludeCorrections.dataGranularity: Provides one row per Employee. The data that is returned is summarized for the selected time period.

columns.label: Paycode Total Actual Days (Exclude Corrections)
columns.description: Returns the day totals for the assigned paycode summed for the timeframe. Note that this column populates a total only for day-type paycodes, excluding day totals that were generated from a historical correction.

columns.label: Paycode Total Actual Hours (Exclude Corrections)
columns.description: Returns the hour totals for the assigned paycode summed for the timeframe. Note that this column populates a total for only hour-type paycodes excluding hour totals that were generated from a historical correction.

columns.label: Paycode Total Actual Wages (Exclude Corrections)
columns.description: Returns the wage totals associated with the assigned paycode summed for the timeframe. Note that this column populates only a total for hour or wage paycodes that have a monetary amount associated with them, excluding those that were generated by a historical correction.

additionalInfo: When using the data columns in the Actual Paycode Totals Exclude Corrections entity, select the desired pay code from all available pay codes, including both Standard and Combined pay codes.

When creating a Dataview, you can add the same data column from Actual Paycode Totals Exclude Corrections entity multiple times, assigning a different pay code to each. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the actual hours that are related to the 'REGULAR' pay code and the 'OVERTIME' pay code, you can add the Paycode Total Actual Hours (Exclude Corrections) data column twice, assigning the 'REGULAR' pay code to one column and the 'OVERTIME' pay code to the other.

You can use the data columns in the Actual Paycode Totals Exclude Corrections entity in conjunction with the data columns in the Projected Paycode Totals Exclude Corrections and the Scheduled Paycode Totals entities to view a comparison of Actual to Projected to Scheduled. To do this, you must disable the Column Relationship Rules in the Dataview and assign the same pay code to the selected data columns in these entities.

actualPaycodeTotalsIncludeCorrections.name: Actual Paycode Totals - Include Corrections
actualPaycodeTotalsIncludeCorrections.description:
The Actual Paycode Totals Include Corrections entity provides the total hours, wages, or days that are related to the selected time period for a selected pay code, including any historical correction totals related to the selected time period.

When creating a Dataview, you can select the pay code for which totals data will be provided. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the hours for each employee related to the 'REGULAR' pay code that apply to the selected time period (including historical corrections made in that period), configure the Paycode Total Actual Hours (Include Corrections) data column with an assignment value of 'REGULAR'.
actualPaycodeTotalsIncludeCorrections.dataGranularity: Provides one row per Employee. The data that is returned is summarized for the selected time period.

columns.label: Paycode Total Actual Days (Include Corrections)
columns.description: Returns the day totals for the assigned paycode summed for the timeframe. Note that this column populates only a total for day-type paycodes, including day totals that were generated from a historical correction

columns.label: Paycode Total Actual Hours (Include Corrections)
columns.description: Returns the hour totals associated with the assigned paycode summed for the timeframe. Note that this column populates only a total for hour-type paycodes, including hour totals that were generated by a historical correction.

columns.label: Paycode Total Actual Wages (Include Corrections)
columns.description: Returns the wage totals associated with the assigned paycode summed for the timeframe. Note that this column populates only a total for hour or wage paycodes that have a monetary amount associated with them, including those that were generated by a historical correction.

additionalInfo: When using the data columns in the Actual Paycode Totals Include Corrections, select the desired pay code from all available pay codes, including both Standard and Combined pay codes.

When creating a Dataview, you can add the same data column from this entity multiple times, assigning a different pay code to each data column added. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the actual hours related to the 'REGULAR' pay code and the 'OVERTIME' pay code, you can add the 'Paycode Total Actual Hours (Include Corrections)' data column twice, assigning the 'REGULAR' pay code to one column and the 'OVERTIME' pay code to the other.

You can use the data columns in the Actual Paycode Totals Include Corrections entity in conjunction with the data columns in the Projected Paycode Totals Include Corrections and the Scheduled Paycode Totals entities to view a comparison of Actual to Projected to Scheduled. To do this, you must disable the Column Relationship Rules in the Dataview and assign the same pay code to the selected data columns in these entities.

actualVolume.name: Actual Volume
actualVolume.description:
The Actual Volume entity provides two columns, actual volume date and version, which provide the date and version of the actual volume data that has been entered in or imported to Workload Planner. Always use the Actual Volume entity in conjunction with the Actual Volume Detail entity and either the Actual Volume Detail — Schedule Zone or Actual Volume Detail — Standard Shift entity. Using data columns from these entities together will provide actual volume data by date, location (above Job) in the Business Structure, and schedule zone or shift set.

Data is supplied for all dates in each schedule period. Version provides the latest version number for which volume is created in the workload planner.
actualVolume.dataGranularity: Provides one row per date per location (above Job) in the Business Structure per schedule zone or shift set in the schedule period.
additionalInfo: If a location has assigned schedule zones, values will be provided in the schedule zone entity data columns. If a location has assigned standard shifts, values will be provided in the standard shift entity data columns. If a location has both standard shifts and schedule zones assigned, values will be provided only in the standard shift entity data columns.
The volume data cannot be correlated with coverage scheduled count data, workload planned count data, or workload budgeted count data.

If you plan to create a Dataview or report data object using plan volume, actual volume, budget volume, plan volume detail, actual volume detail, and budget volume detail, you must disable the column relationship rules.

actualVolumeScheduleZone.name: Actual Volume - Schedule Zone
actualVolumeScheduleZone.description:
The Actual Volume - Schedule Zone entity provides the schedule zone details for the actual volume data that is present in Workload Planner.

Because the Actual Volume - Schedule Zone entity does not have a relationship with the Actual Volume Detail entity that stores the actual volume value, it is recommended that you use the Actual Volume Detail - Schedule Zone entity instead. Both entities provide the same information.
actualVolumeScheduleZone.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location and schedule zone.

actualVolumeScheduleZoneSet.name: Actual Volume - Schedule Zone Set
actualVolumeScheduleZoneSet.description: The Actual Volume - Schedule Zone Set entity provides the schedule zone set that is assigned to a location in the workload set up.
actualVolumeScheduleZoneSet.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location above Job in the Business Structure.
additionalInfo: Because volume is created only for locations above Job in the Workload Planner, the Actual Volume – Schedule Zone Set entity can be used only for locations above Job (for example, Department) in Workload Planner.

A schedule zone set can contain multiple schedule zones that have been defined for a location. Schedule zones within the schedule zone set have exclusive start and end times. A schedule zone set cannot exceed 24 hours in length.

actualVolumeStandardShift.name: Actual Volume - Standard Shift
actualVolumeStandardShift.description:
The Actual Volume - Standard Shift entity provides the standard shifts for the actual volume data that is present in Workload Planner.

Because the Actual Volume - Standard Shift entity does not have a relationship with the Actual Volume Detail entity that stores the actual volume value, it is recommended that you use the Actual Volume Detail - Standard Shift entity instead.
actualVolumeStandardShift.dataGranularity: Provides many rows per location (above Job) in the Business Structure.

actualVolumeStandardShiftSet.name: Actual Volume - Standard Shift Set
actualVolumeStandardShiftSet.description: The Actual Volume - Standard Shift Set entity provides the standard shift set that is assigned to a location in the Business Structure.
actualVolumeStandardShiftSet.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure per standard shift.
additionalInfo: Because volume is created only for locations above Job in the Workload Planner, the Actual Volume - Standard Shift Set entity can be used only for locations above Job in the Business Structure.
A standard shift set can contain many standard shifts that have been defined for a location.

actualVolumeDetail.name: Actual Volume Detail
actualVolumeDetail.description: The Actual Volume Detail entity provides actual volume data. You should always use this entity along with the Actual Volume entity and either the Actual Volume Detail Schedule Zone or the Actual Volume Detail Standard Shift entity. Using them together will provide data in a schedule period for actual volume values by date, by location (above Job) in the Business Structure, and by either schedule zone or shift sets.
actualVolumeDetail.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure, per date, per schedule zone or shift set.
additionalInfo: Actual Volume Detail data cannot be analyzed only by department or only by department and date because the current data model does not support aggregation at those levels. The actual volume detail data can be analyzed only by department, span (zone or shift name), and date. This is the granularity at which the data is provided.
The volume data cannot be correlated with coverage scheduled count data, workload planned count data, or workload budgeted count data.
If you plan to create a Dataview or report data object using plan volume detail, actual volume detail, and budget volume detail together, you must disable the column relationship rules.

actualVolumeDetailScheduleZone.name: Actual Volume Detail - Schedule Zone
actualVolumeDetailScheduleZone.description: The Actual Volume Detail - Schedule Zone entity provides the zone details for the actual volume data that is present in Workload Planner. These can be analyzed by location (above Job) in the Business Structure.
actualVolumeDetailScheduleZone.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure per schedule zone.
additionalInfo: If you plan to create a Dataview or report data object using plan volume detail, actual volume detail, and budget volume detail together by actual volume detail schedule zone, you must disable the column relationship rules.

Because a schedule zone set can contain multiple schedule zones that have been defined for a location, the granularity of the data provided by the Actual Volume Detail — Schedule Zone entity is one row per location and schedule zone.

actualVolumeDetailStandardShift.name: Actual Volume Detail - Standard Shift
actualVolumeDetailStandardShift.description: The Actual Volume Detail - Standard Shift entity provides the standard shift details for the actual volume data that is created in Workload Planner. These can be analyzed by location (above Job) in the Business Structure. (Volume is not created at the Job level.)
actualVolumeDetailStandardShift.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure per standard shift.
actualVolumeDetailStandardShift.additionalInfo: If you plan to create a Dataview or report data object using plan volume detail, actual volume detail, and budget volume detail together by actual volume detail standard shift, you must disable the column relationship rules.

analytics.name: Analytics
analytics.description: The Analytics entity provides the metrics and KPIs that are defined in the product and those metrics and KPIs that are custom-defined. The metrics and KPIs provide a means to measure labor management performance in areas like overtime, absenteeism, and productivity. Use the data columns in Employee Dataviews and reports to measure and compare individual employee performance or in Business Structure Dataviews and reports to measure and compare organizational entities, such as job, department, region, or location.

dataGranularity.employee: Provides one row per employee for the defined time period.
dataGranularity.businessStructure: Provides one row per selected Location Type for the defined time period.

approvalSummary.name: Approval Summary
approvalSummary.description: The Approval Summary entity provides the data columns that are necessary to understand the status of an employee's timecard approval, indicating for a period of time whether the timecard has been approved by the manager or employee.
approvalSummary.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee for the defined time period.

columns.label: All Time Approved
columns.description: (Multiple Approvers) Indicates if all time for the user has been approved (Yes or No).

approvalTransactions.name: Approval Transactions
approvalTransactions.description:
The Approval Transactions entity provides data columns about each timecard approval transaction, including who approved the transaction (manager or employee), if the approval was applied to the timecard, and when the timecard was approved.

The data is returned per approval per day. Therefore, if a manager is approving an employee's timecard for a five-day work period, the data will return five rows, one row for every day that was approved in the time period.
approvalTransactions.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee and approved day for the selected time period.

approvalsReviewers.name: Approvals Reviewers
approvalsReviewers.description: The Approvals Reviewers entity provides the information related to each employee's overtime approval level, settings, and assigned approvers.
approvalsReviewers.dataGranularity: The data can return several rows per employee. There is a limit of 5 approval levels.

columns.label: Overtime Approval Level
columns.description: The employee's assigned overtime approval level.

columns.label: Overtime Approve Within (Days)
columns.description: The employee's assigned overtime approve within setting.

columns.label: Overtime Approver
columns.description: The employee's assigned overtime approver.

attendanceActionsSummary.name: Attendance Actions Summary
attendanceActionsSummary.description: The Attendance Actions Summary entity provides the data columns that are necessary to view data related to the most recent Attendance action associated with employees for the defined time period. You can create a Dataview that shows the action that was triggered by the Attendance application and all details related to that action, such as the date on which it was triggered, the date on which it was completed, the status of the action, and the balance associated with it.

attendanceSummary.name: Attendance Summary
attendanceSummary.description: The Attendance Summary entity provides the columns necessary to retrieve data related to the latest Attendance action associated with each employee and the Attendance balances for each employee. The Attendance Summary data columns are primarily used for creating Dataviews and reports that provide the various Attendance balances associated with each employee. The balance data columns are parameterized to allow the specific balance to be provided and to support the creation of a Dataview that can present multiple balance types as columns.

attendanceTransactions.name: Attendance Transactions
attendanceTransactions.description:
The Attendance Transactions entity exposes the transactional data generated by the Attendance application. Data can be retrieved for the following types of Attendance transactions:

Action
Balance Reset
Balance Update
Event
Expiring Point
Perfect Attendance Award
Perfect Attendance Deduction
Perfect Attendance Disqualification

In addition, the Attendance Transactions provides daily balance data and period start and end balance data. The data provided in this entity is also available on the Attendance Details page of the application.

The data columns in the Attendance Transactions entity are organized by the type of transaction and the same data column, such as Balance Name, exists for each transaction type. Use the Category name in the data column selector to identify the transaction type and select the data columns necessary to report on that particular type of transaction. Each transaction type has all the data columns necessary for reporting on that specific area. It is recommended that Dataviews and reports use only those data columns related to a single transaction type.
attendanceTransactions.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per Attendance transaction.

columns.label: Daily Summary Ending Time Balance Amount
Daily Summary Starting Time Balance Amount

attestationDailyDetail.name: Attestation Daily Detail
attestationDailyDetail.description: The Attestation Daily Detail entity provides data related to the questions asked and responses that an employee submitted when attesting to punches, totals, and breaks. Using this information, a manager can see how employees are answering the questions that were posed to them and the time required for a response.
attestationDailyDetail.dataGranularity: One row per employee per Attestation question answered.

columns.label: Manual Time Entry Status

audit.name: Audit
audit.description: The Audit entity provides data related to timecard transactions, including the addition, edit, or removal of punches, paycode edits, comments, and leave edits. The data columns allow for the creation of Dataviews and reports that provide the data available through the Audit add-on that is visible in the timecard.
audit.dataGranularity: One row per employee per audited transaction.

auditAttendance.name: Audit Attendance
auditAttendance.description: The Audit Attendance entity provides data related to Attendance transactions of all types (such as Events, Balance Adjustments, and Actions). The data columns allow for the creation of Dataviews and reports that allow managers to clearly audit the use of the Attendance application by their employees.
auditAttendance.dataGranularity: One row per employee per Attendance transaction (such as Events, Balance Adjustments, and Actions).

auditAvailability.name: Audit Availability
auditAvailability.description:
The ability to create Dataviews and reports that provide detailed audit information related to the adding, editing, or deleting of the availability of employees requires the use of data columns from four different entities in the Data "Dictionary": Audit Availability, Schedule Availability, Schedule Segment Availability, and Availability Type.

This family of data columns provide the data necessary to understand who added, edited, or deleted an employee's availability and the type of action taken by the user (Insert, Update, or Delete).

The Schedule Availability data columns provide a unique identifier for the availability version, the date to which the availability applies, and indicators that identify the availability as system-generated and deleted.

The Schedule Segment Availability data columns provide the start and end times of the schedule segment to which the availability applies.

The Availability Type data column provides the type of availability related to a specific schedule segment (Available, Unavailable, Preferred, or Preferred Time Off).

All data columns can be used together in a Dataview, but it is necessary to disable the Column Relationship Rules. This will allow you to create a Dataview that provides key audit information related to availability.
auditAvailability.dataGranularity: One row per employee per Availability action (add, edit, or delete).

auditForecasting.name: Audit Forecasting
auditForecasting.description: The Audit Forecasting entity provides columns for use in a Dataview or report that return audit data for a given Forecasting entity type.
auditForecasting.dataGranularity: Provides one row per category per time period (date or forecast week) per entity type.

auditLeave.name: Audit Leave
auditLeave.description: The Audit Leave entity provides data related to Leave transactions, including the creation, editing, and removal of leave cases and associated documents. The data columns allow for the creation of Dataviews and reports that allow managers to clearly audit the use of the Leave application by their employees.
auditLeave.dataGranularity: One row per employee per Leave transaction.

auditSchedule.name: Audit Schedule
auditSchedule.description: The Audit Schedule entity provides data that enables you to create Dataviews and reports that can be used to examine all schedule audits for a location or a group of employees. It also provides information that can help determine how many schedule edits managers are making, which employee schedules are being edited, and which managers are making those edits.

auditTimekeeping.name: Audit Timekeeping
auditTimekeeping.description: The Audit Timekeeping entity provides data related specifically to punch transactions, including the addition, editing, and removal of punches, punch comments, and notes. The data columns allow for the creation of Dataviews and reports that allow managers to clearly audit modifications to employee punches.
auditTimekeeping.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per punch-related transaction.

auditorCountMonth.name: Auditor Count (Month)
auditorCountMonth.description: The Auditor Count (Month) entity provides data related to timecard transactions for the current month, including the addition, edit, or removal of meals, punches, paycode edits, and exceptions. It also provides the change in the Auditor Count from the previous month to the current month as a percentage.

availabilityPatternRequestDetail.name: Availability Pattern Request Detail
availabilityPatternRequestDetail.description:
The Availability Pattern Request Detail entity makes data available to Dataviews and Report Data Objects that allow managers to review the availability pattern change requests made by employees. This allows manager to better understand the number of requests, the employees making those requests, and the status of those requests. With this information, managers can better ensure that availability pattern requests are being approved or rejected in a timely manner, which employees are regularly requesting availability pattern changes, and which are not.

The Availability Pattern Request Detail entity must have a relationship to the Employee Details core entity. This will allow the administrator who creates a Dataview or Report Data Object to include any of the data columns in the Employee Details entity with the data columns from the Availability Pattern Request Detail entity.

availabilityRequestDetail.name: Availability Request Detail
availabilityRequestDetail.description:
The Availability Request Detail entity provides data that enables you to create Dataviews and reports that can be used to review availability requests that are made by employees. This data allows you to determine the number of requests, which employees are making the requests, and the status of the requests. Given this information managers can better ensure that availability requests are being approved or rejected in a timely manner and learn which employees are or are not regularly requesting availability changes.

Use the columns in the Employee Details entity along with those in the Availability Request Detail entity to view data columns associated with the employee that is related to the availability request.

Note that the selected time frame is used to bring up requests based on the dates included in the request, and not the date on which the request was submitted.

columns.description: Current status of the availability request at the time the Dataview or report data object is executed

availabilityRequestStatusHistory.description:
The Availability Request Status History entity allows a user to see the path that a request for availability has taken through the approval process, such as who has changed the status of a request and when that status was changed.

Use the columns in the Employee Details entity along with those in the Availability Request Status History entity to view data columns associated with the employee that is related to the availability request.

If the Column Relationship Rules are enabled and the user selects a column from the Availability Request Status History entity, the user cannot add columns from the Availability Request Detail entity.

availabilityType.name: Availability Type
availabilityType.description:
The Availability Type entity provides a single data column for use when creating a Dataview or report that provides audit information related to Availability. The Availability Type data column provides the type of availability related to a specific schedule segment (Available, Unavailable, Preferred, or Preferred Time Off).

For more information on analyzing Availability audit data, see the Audit Availability entity.

averageWorkedHours.name: Average Worked Hours
averageWorkedHours.description:
The Average Worked Hours entity provides the data columns that are necessary to measure the average number of hours worked by employees per week. This data allows managers to understand if employees who are designated as full-time or part-time” are actually working the appropriate number of hours on average over a defined period of time.

The entity provides two calculations of Average Weekly Hours. For both calculations, the application determines the Total Hours worked based on a standard combined pay code. Clients must configure this combined pay code (FTPT Contributing Pay Codes) with the other pay codes that they want to count towards this calculation.

The Total Hours value is then used to calculate Average Weekly Hours (All Weeks) and Average Weekly Hours (Worked Only). The All Weeks version is calculated as Totals Hours / Worked Weeks (All Weeks) where the system calculates the number of weeks by determining the days in the defined time period and dividing that by 7. Only complete weeks are counted.

The Worked Weeks version is calculated as Totals Hours / Worked Weeks (Worked Weeks) where the system calculates the number of weeks by first determining the days in the defined time period and dividing that by 7. It then includes only those weeks in which the employee has had a transaction using one of the pay codes configured in the FTPT Contributing Pay Codes combined pay code. Here too, only complete weeks are counted.
averageWorkedHours.dataGranularity: Provides on row per employee for the selected timeframe

budgetVolume.name: Budget Volume
budgetVolume.description:
The Budget Volume entity provides two columns, budget volume date and version, which provide the date and version for the budget volume data that has been entered in or imported to Workload Planner. Always use the Budget Volume entity in conjunction with the Budget Volume Detail entity and either the Budget Volume Detail — Schedule Zone or Budget Volume Detail — Standard Shift entity. Using data columns from these entities together will provide budget volume data by date, location (above Job) in the Business Structure, and schedule zone or shift set.

Data is supplied for all dates in each schedule period. Version provides the latest version number for which volume is created in the workload planner.
budgetVolume.dataGranularity: Provides one row per date, per location (above Job) in the Business Structure, per schedule zone or shift set in each schedule period.
additionalInfo: If a location has assigned schedule zones, values will be provided in the schedule zone entity data columns. If a location has assigned standard shifts, values will be provided in the standard shift entity data columns. If a location has both standard shifts and schedule zones assigned, values will be provided only in the standard shift entity data columns
The volume data cannot be correlated with coverage scheduled count data, workload planned count data, or workload budgeted count data

If you plan to create a Dataview or report data object using plan volume, actual volume, budget volume, plan volume detail, actual volume detail, and budget volume detail, you must disable the column relationship rules

budgetVolumeScheduleZone.name: Budget Volume - Schedule Zone
budgetVolumeScheduleZone.description:
The Budget Volume - Schedule Zone entity provides the schedule zone details for the budget volume data that is present in Workload Planner.

Because the Budget Volume - Schedule Zone entity does not have a relationship with the Budget Volume Detail entity that stores the budget volume value, it is recommended that you use the Budget Volume Detail - Schedule Zone entity instead.
budgetVolumeScheduleZone.dataGranularity: Provides multiple rows per location (above Job) in the Business Structure.

budgetVolumeScheduleZoneSet.name: Budget Volume - Schedule Zone Set
budgetVolumeScheduleZoneSet.description: The Budget Volume - Schedule Zone Set entity provides the schedule zone set that is assigned to a location in the Business Structure.
budgetVolumeScheduleZoneSet.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure.
budgetVolumeScheduleZoneSet.additionalInfo: A schedule zone set can contain multiple schedule zones that have been defined for a location. Schedule zones within the schedule zone set have exclusive start and end times. A schedule zone set cannot exceed 24 hours in length.

budgetVolumeStandardShift.name: Budget Volume - Standard Shift
budgetVolumeStandardShift.description:
The Budget Volume - Standard Shift entity provides the standard shifts for budget volume data that is present in Workload Planner.

Because the Budget Volume - Standard Shift entity does not have a relationship with the Budget Volume Detail entity that stores the budget volume value, it is recommended that you use the Budget Volume Detail - Standard Shift entity instead.
budgetVolumeStandardShift.dataGranularity: Provides many rows per location (above Job) in the Business Structure.

budgetVolumeStandardShiftSet.name: Budget Volume - Standard Shift Set
budgetVolumeStandardShiftSet.description: The Budget Volume - Standard Shift Set entity provides the standard shift set that is assigned to a location in the Business Structure.
budgetVolumeStandardShiftSet.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure.
budgetVolumeStandardShiftSet.additionalInfo: A standard shift set can have many standard shifts defined for a location.

budgetVolumeDetail.name: Budget Volume Detail
budgetVolumeDetail.description: The Budget Volume Detail entity provides budget volume data. You always use this entity along with the Budget Volume entity and either the Budget Volume Detail Schedule Zone or the Budget Volume Detail Standard Shift entity. Using them together will provide data in a schedule period for budget volume values by date, by location (above Job) in the Business Structure, and by schedule zone or shift sets.
budgetVolumeDetail.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure per date per schedule zone or shift set.
additionalInfo: Budget Volume Detail data cannot be analyzed only by department or only by department and date because the current data model does not support aggregation of data at those levels. The budget volume detail data can be analyzed only by department, span (zone or shift name), and date. This is the granularity at which the data is provided
The volume data cannot be correlated with coverage scheduled count data, workload planned count data, or workload actual count data
If you plan to create a Dataview or report data object using plan volume detail, actual volume detail, and budget volume detail together, you must disable the column relationship rules

budgetVolumeDetailScheduleZone.name: Budget Volume Detail - Schedule Zone
budgetVolumeDetailScheduleZone.description: The Budget Volume Detail - Schedule Zone entity provides the zone details for budget volume data that is present in Workload Planner. These can be analyzed by location (above Job) in the Business Structure.
budgetVolumeDetailScheduleZone.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure per schedule zone.
additionalInfo: If you plan to create a Dataview or report data object using plan volume detail, actual volume detail, and budget volume detail together by actual volume detail schedule zone, you must disable the column relationship rules

Because a schedule zone set can contain multiple schedule zones that have been defined for a location, the granularity of the data provided by the Budget Volume Detail — Schedule Zone entity is one row per location and schedule zone

budgetVolumeDetailStandardShift.name: Budget Volume Detail - Standard Shift
budgetVolumeDetailStandardShift.description: The Budget Volume Detail - Standard Shift entity provides the standard shift details for the budget volume data that is created in Workload Planner. These can be analyzed by location (above Job) in the Business Structure. (Volume is not created at the Job level).
budgetVolumeDetailStandardShift.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure per standard shift.
budgetVolumeDetailStandardShift.additionalInfo: If you plan to create a Dataview or report data object using plan volume detail, actual volume detail, and budget volume detail together by budget volume detail standard shift, you must disable the column relationship rules.

coverRequest.name: Cover Request
coverRequest.description:
The Cover Request entity provides data that enables you to create Dataviews and reports that can be used to review requests for coverage that are made by employees to determine the number of requests, which employees are making the requests, and the status of the requests. Given this information managers can better ensure that requests for coverage are being approved or rejected in a timely manner, learn which employees are or are not regularly requesting other employees to cover their shifts, and see whether cover requests are being accepted or rejected by other employees.

Use the columns in the Employee Details entity along with those in the Open Shift Request entity to view data columns associated with the employee that is related to the open shift request.

coverageScheduledCount.name: Coverage - Scheduled Count

exceptionCounter.name: Exception Counter
exceptionCounter.description: The Exception Counter entity data column provides the actual number of exceptions that an employee has triggered over a given time period. The data provided is a count of unresolved exceptions. The column is parameterized, allowing the user to pick the exception type that is associated to the exception count. A user can add multiple columns and select different parameters for each column to show the exception count for multiple exceptions in a single Dataview or report.
exceptionCounter.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee for the defined time period.

exceptions.name: Exceptions
exceptions.description:
The Exceptions entity provides, at a transactional level, the necessary data columns to report on the exceptions triggered by employees, based on the exception rules that have been configured in the system (for example, Late In-Punch).

The Exceptions entity returns one row per employee per exception. Therefore, if an employee has triggered three exceptions on a given day, three rows are returned.
exceptions.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per exception for the defined time period.

columns.label: Missing Time Status
columns.description: The status of exception in terms of Missing Time Justification (Employee Justified, Manager Justified, Auto-resolved)

additionalInfo: Because the data is processed at the transactional level, it is important for users to include the Exception Type and Exception Apply Date columns when creating a Dataview or report so that they can understand the data that is being returned

The Actual Punch Date Time column provides the actual date and time at which the employee punched in or punched out in relation to an exception. Users can add this column to view the actual punch time (In or Out) related to exceptions that are associated with an actual punch

The Scheduled Punch Date Time column provides the date and time at which the employee was scheduled to punch in or punch out in relation to an exception. Users can add this column when creating a Dataview or report to view the scheduled punch time (In or Out) related to exceptions that are associated with a scheduled punch.

employeeHcmBaseCompensation.name: Employee HCM - Base Compensation
employeeHcmBaseCompensation.description: The Base Compensation entity provides the employee's current base compensation information in the primary EIN, such as salary and salary increase %. It returns the latest data for an employee and is not dependent on the time period selected in Dataview or report.
employeeHcmBaseCompensation.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per selected time period.

employeeHcmBenefitPlanSummary.name: Employee HCM - Benefit Plan Summary
employeeHcmBenefitPlanSummary.description: The Benefit Plan Summary entity provides a count of the active benefit plans in which the employee is enrolled across all EINs and their names.
employeeHcmBenefitPlanSummary.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per selected time period.

employeeHcmDates.name: Employee HCM - Dates
employeeHcmDates.description: The Dates entity provides age, employment length, termination length, and benefits date for an employee.
employeeHcmDates.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per selected time period.

columns.label: Employment Length (Days)
columns.description:
If the employee's current status is terminated then The Employment Length is calculated based on the terminated date minus the hire date.

If the employee's current status is not terminated, then the Employment Length is calculated as the current date minus the hire date.

If there is a rehire event present for employee ever then the Employment Length is calculated as the current date minus the rehire date. Otherwise its value is 0 (zero).

columns.label: Years of Service (Days)
columns.description:
If there is a rehire event present for employee and the employee's current state is terminated, then Years of Service is calculated "as": [(latest termination date minus the rehire date) plus (the previous termination date minus the hire date)].

If there is a rehire event present for the employee and the employee's current state is not terminated, then Years of Service is calculated "as": [(the current date minus the rehire date) plus (the termination date minus the hire date)].

If there is no rehire event present for the employee and the employee's current state is terminated then Years of Service calculated as the termination date minus the hire date.

If there is no rehire event present for the employee and the employee's current state is not terminated, then Years of Service is calculated as the current date minus the hire date.

columns.label: Termination Length (Days)
columns.description: If the employee"s current status is terminated then Termination Length is calculated based on the current date minus the termination date. Otherwise, it"s value is 0 (zero).

employeeHcmDemographics.name: Employee HCM - Demographics
employeeHcmDemographics.description: The Demographics entity provides demographic information for an employee, such as age, ethnicity, marital status, and education. It returns the current data for an employee and is not dependent on the time period selected in Dataview or report.
employeeHcmDemographics.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per selected time period.

employeeHcmPersonalInformation.name: Employee HCM - Personal Information
employeeHcmPersonalInformation.description: The Personal Information entity provides the employee's personal information, such as address and role details. It returns the current data for an employee and is not dependent on the time period selected in Dataview or report.
employeeHcmPersonalInformation.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per selected time period.

columns.label: Pay Statement Electronic Consent Given On

employeeHcmPerspectiveScore.name: Employee HCM - Perspective Score
employeeHcmPerspectiveScore.description: The Perspective Score entity provides the employee's latest score for a given perspective in the selected time period in the primary EIN.
employeeHcmPerspectiveScore.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per selected time period.

employeeHcmTerminationDetails.name: Employee HCM - Termination Details
employeeHcmTerminationDetails.description:
The Termination Details entity provides the most recent termination details for an employee in the primary EIN. These details do not change based on the time period that is selected.

This entity requires that users select the appropriate Hyperfind in the Dataview or report to select terminated employees, specifying today's date, a specific date, or a specified time period. The entity then returns columns for all terminated employees and their termination details.
employeeHcmTerminationDetails.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per selected time period.

employeeHcmWorkersClaims.name: Employee HCM - Workers Claims
employeeHcmWorkersClaims.description: The Workers Claims entity provides a count of injuries across all EINs for the employee in the selected time period.
employeeHcmWorkersClaims.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per selected time period.

floatDetails.name: Float Details
floatDetails.description: The Float Details entity provides data for employees who float in and out of selected units. It includes details about the job that was worked, how many hours were floated. It also indicates whether the float is measured in scheduled or in actual time.
floatDetails.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per float event.

columns.label: Float Actual Hours Indicator
columns.description: Indication of whether floated hours are from the employee timecard

columns.label: Float Duration
columns.description: Duration of the employee float

columns.label: Float End Date Time
columns.description: End date and time of the employee float

columns.label: Float Job
columns.description: Job to which the employee was floated

columns.label: Float Job (Path)
columns.description: Full path to the job to which the employee was floated

columns.label: Float Location (Path)
columns.description: Full path to the location to which the employee was floated

columns.label: Float Shift Start Date
columns.description: Float shift start date

columns.label: Float Start Date Time
columns.description: Start date and time of the employee float

columns.label: Float Type
columns.description: Indication of whether the employee has floated in or out

columns.label: Schedule Shift ID
columns.description: Shift ID of the scheduled shift

columns.label: Work Item ID
columns.description: ID of the work item

gateAccess.name: Gate Access
gateAccess.description: The Gate Access Entity allows customers to employee dataview to show all EDR/gate swipes, including device, badge info.

columns.label: Device ID
columns.description: Device ID employee used to access gate

columns.label: Device Name
columns.description: Device Name employee used to access gate

columns.label: Gate Access Date
columns.description: Date employee accessed the gate

columns.label: Gate Access Time
columns.description: Time employee accessed the gate

columns.label: Gate Access Type
columns.description: Type of Gate

groupEditResults.name: Group Edit Results
groupEditResults.description: The Group Edit Results entity provides the data columns necessary to understand the record of successful and failed edits that were performed in a single operation on a group of employees.
groupEditResults.dataGranularity: Provides one row per Group Edit transaction.

hoursOfOperation.name: Hours of Operation
hoursOfOperation.description: Use the Hours of Operation entity in Dataviews and reports to allow managers to view a store's hours of operation. This can enable them to view store operations against scheduled hours, for example, to ensure that they have enough people scheduled throughout the day, particularly at opening and closing times. In addition, because the hours of operation can change during periods of unusual activity, it is useful for managers to have this information on their daily reports to alert them to such changes.
hoursOfOperation.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location, per date, per hours of operation item in the selected date range.

columns.label: Hours of Operation Date
columns.description: Date of the hours of operation

columns.label: Hours of Operation End Time
columns.description: The end time of the hours of operation

columns.label: Hours of Operation Is Closed
columns.description: Indicates whether the hours of operation are marked as closed

columns.label: Hours of Operation Is Override
columns.description: Indicates whether the hours of operation are an override to the regular hours of operation

columns.label: Hours of Operation Location (Path)
columns.description: Full business structure path of the locations that are associated with the hours of operation

columns.label: Hours of Operation Start Time
columns.description: The start time of the hours of operation

hoursOfOperation.additionalInfo:
For custom reports, it may be sufficient to build separate Business Structure Report Data Objects each with a location type for the specific business structure node where hours of operation are needed. Multiple report data objects could then be joined to create the custom report. This would avoid the need to create a business structure Dataview with a location type of Job and have all locations returned as a separate row.

"Note": Joining of Report Data Objects in BIRT Studio is not supported.

dailyProductivity.name: Daily Productivity
dailyProductivity.description: The Daily Productivity entity provides work unit productivity data based on daily timekeeping totals, regular and supplemental labor details, and fixed and variable targets compared to actual hours and amounts.

dataGranularity.workUnit: Provides one row (for each column) for each work unit for each date returned.
dataGranularity.workUnitTimeSeries: Provides one row (for each column) for each work unit for each time increment (resolved by input supportedTypes: DAY, WEEK, MONTH, QUARTER) returned.

Labor Categories may be used to describe what an employee has worked on, such as a project or a contract. The provided data columns allow the user to create Dataviews that show the labor categories in which an employee worked or was scheduled to work.

leaveCase.name: Leave Case
leaveCase.description:
The Leave Case entity provides all of the detailed information related to each leave case that has been opened by employees. This is the primary entity for leave. It allows users to look at the cases related to the employees in their organization. It provides all of the information that is relevant to each leave case, such as the type of leave, the start and end dates of the leave case, the current status of the leave case, and the reason for the leave case.

The data columns available in the Leave Case entity can be used with other leave-related entities to generate Dataviews and reports. For example, you can use the Leave Case data columns with columns from the Leave Case Document entity to see the documents that are associated with a leave case and their status.
leaveCase.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per leave case.

columns.label: Certification Total Time Amount Per Period
Leave Case Committed Continuous Paid Hours
Leave Case Committed Continuous Tracking Hours
Leave Case Committed Intermittent Paid Hours
Leave Case Committed Intermittent Tracking Hours
Leave Case Custom Amount of Time
Leave Case Default Days Of Week
Leave Case Latest Committed Paid Date
Leave Case Latest Committed Tracking Date

leaveCaseDocument.name: Leave Case Document
leaveCaseDocument.description:
The Leave Case Document entity provides detailed information related to the documents associated with a leave case. This includes the due date for a leave document, the date the document was generated, and the status of the document.

Always use the Leave Case Document entity in conjunction with the data columns from the Leave Case entity. This allows you to associate the leave document with the appropriate leave case in the Dataview or report that you are creating.
leaveCaseDocument.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per leave case document.

leaveCaseNote.name: Leave Case Note
leaveCaseNote.description:
The Leave Case Note entity provides the text of any notes applied to a leave case. The available data columns include the date the note was entered and the name of the user that entered the note.

Always use the Leave Case Note entity in conjunction with data columns from the Leave Case entity. This allows you to associate the note with the appropriate leave case in the Dataview or report that you are creating.
leaveCaseNote.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per leave case note.

leaveCaseNotification.name: Leave Case Notification
leaveCaseNotification.description:
The Leave Case Notification entity provides information related to the notifications generated by leave requests and leave cases. The available data columns include the date the notification was sent and any note text that is included with the notification.

Always use the Leave Case Notification entity in conjunction with data columns from the Leave Case entity. This allows you to associate the notification with the appropriate leave case in the Dataview or report that you are creating.
leaveCaseNotification.dataGranularity: Provides one row of data per employee per leave case notification.

leaveEdit.name: Leave Edit
leaveEdit.description:
The Leave Edit entity provides detailed information related to leave-related group edits, such as adding leave time to the leave cases of multiple employees. The available data columns include the date of the leave edit, the start time that is associated with the leave event, and the duration of the leave event for the specific date.

Always use the Leave Edit entity in conjunction with data columns from the Leave Case entity. This allows you to associate the leave events resulting from the group edit with the appropriate leave case in the Dataview or report that you are creating.
leaveEdit.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per leave event that has been generated by a group edit.

leaveProfile.name: Leave Profile
leaveProfile.description:
The Leave Profile entity provides the name and description of the Leave Profile that is currently assigned to an employee. It also includes a data column that indicates if the Leave Profile is active. The Leave Profile assignment is not effective-dated.

Use the Leave Profile entity with the other leave-related entities to provide the employee's assigned Leave Profile in a Dataview or report.

leaveTaking.name: Leave Taking
leaveTaking.description:
The Leave Taking entity provides the information related to each unique taking of leave time that is associated with a specific leave case. You can retrieve the amount of the taking in hours or days, as well as the wages related to the taking. The data also identifies the Accrual Code that is associated with the leave taking.

For best results, include the Leave Case Code data column from the Leave Case entity when using the Leave Taking data columns. This allows you to identify the associated Leave Case in Dataviews and reports that you create.
leaveTaking.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per leave taking.

licenseAssignment.name: License Assignment
licenseAssignment.description: The License Assignment entity provides the data column necessary to understand the product licenses and roles that are currently assigned to an employee. Dataviews return one row per assigned license and role. For example, if a user is assigned two licenses and two roles, four rows of data is returned for that user.
licenseAssignment.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per assigned license or role.

location.name: Location
location.description: The Location entity provides the data columns necessary to identify the actual place a job was worked by or scheduled for an employee. The Location entity is based on the Business Structure defined in the application.

locationSchedulingIndicators.name: Location Scheduling Indicators
locationSchedulingIndicators.description: The Location Scheduling Indicators column provides data that allows you to create Dataviews that show the values for one or more location-based indicators that have been defined for scheduling metrics.

Indicators are configured in Application Setup > Scheduler Setup > Metrics Setup > Indicators. The selections that are provided in the list are determined by the type of Dataview (here, Business Structure) and the formula that is used in the indicator

mobileApp.name: Mobile App
mobileApp.description: The Mobile App entity allows for the creation of mobile app-usage reports for a defined time period and user list. Specific device specifications, device settings, and last user login can be captured. A system setting allows for limiting the collected data to certain general items (such as App ID, Device type, and last login time) if more detailed information (such as access settings and specific device specifications) does not need to be tracked.

onPremise.name: On Premise
onPremise.description: The On Premise entity returns on-premises information for employees. It is used in Dataviews and Report Data Objects to allow managers to determine whether a particular hourly employee has shown up for work today. It is typically used with the Employee Details entity, along with the Exception Counter and Exceptions entities.

columns.label: On Premises
columns.description: On Premises flag. True if the employee is currently on premises

columns.label: On Premises and Pay from Schedule
columns.description: On Premises and Pay from Schedule flag. True if the employee is on premises and was paid from schedule

additionalInfo: The columns provided in the On Premise entity always reflect the employee's status for the current day regardless of the time frame that is selected in the Dataview or report.

Employees are considered on premise if they: performed an in-punch today with the current time, performed punches over a time span that includes breaks, are assigned as pay from schedule and are within that shift, are assigned as pay from schedule and have performed an in-punch

openShiftRequest.name: Open Shift Request
openShiftRequest.description:
The Open Shift Request entity provides data that enables you to create Dataviews and reports that can be used to review open shift requests that are made by employees to determine the number of requests, which employees are making the requests, and the status of the requests. Given this information managers can better ensure that open shift requests are being approved or rejected in a timely manner, learn which employees are or are not regularly requesting open shifts, and see whether open shifts are remaining unfilled.

Use the columns in the Employee Details entity along with those in the Open Shift Request entity to view data columns associated with the employee that is related to the open shift request.
openShiftRequest.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per requested open shift segment.
