openShiftRequestStatusHistory.name: Open Shift Request Status History
openShiftRequestStatusHistory.description:
The Open Shift Request Status History entity allows a user to see the path that an open shift request has taken through the approval process, such as who has changed the status of a request and when that status was changed.

Use the columns in the Employee Details entity along with those in the Open Shift Request Status History entity to view data columns associated with the employees that are related to the cover request.
openShiftRequestStatusHistory.dataGranularity: One row per employee per request item per status change.

columns.label: Open Shift Request ID (Status History)
columns.description: System identifier of the open shift request

columns.label: Open Shift Request Status Change Date
columns.description: Date and time when the user modified the status of the open shift request

columns.label: Open Shift Request Status Change User
columns.description: Name of the user who modified the status of the open shift request

columns.label: Open Shift Request Changed From
columns.description: Status of the open shift request before the change was made by the user

columns.label: Open Shift Request Changed To
columns.description: Status of the open shift request after the change was made by the user

openShiftRequestStatusHistory.additionalInfo: The Open Shift Request Status History entity does not have a relationship with the Open Shift Request entity because the entities provide the data at different levels of granularity. If the Column Relationship Rules are enabled and the user selects a column from the Open Shift Request Status History entity, the user cannot add columns from the Open Shift Request entity.

overtimeApprovers.name: Overtime Approvers
overtimeApprovers.description:
The Overtime Approvers entity provides data columns that allow the creation of Dataviews and Report Data Objects that provide information on all overtime approvers that are assigned to employees.

This entity is purely for reporting on the overtime approvers assigned to each employee. It is not intended to be used with transactional data.
overtimeApprovers.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per assigned overtime approver.

columns.label: Overtime Approval Level
columns.description: Employee's assigned overtime approval level

columns.label: Overtime Approve Within (Days)
columns.description: Employee's assigned overtime approve within setting

columns.label: Overtime Approver
columns.description: Employee's assigned overtime approver

payPeriod.name: Pay Period
payPeriod.description:
The Pay Period entity provides the data columns necessary to understand the start and end date for the previous, current, and next pay periods.  The length of the pay period is defined by an employee's assigned pay rule.

Note that the previous, current, and next pay periods are always based on the current date and not on a selected time frame (for example, you cannot look back three weeks in history and extract data for the current pay period at that time).
payPeriod.dataGranularity: N/A - Pay Period provides only dimensional data.

columns.label: Previous Pay Period Sign Off Indicator

payRuleAssignmentHistory.name: Pay Rule Assignment History
payRuleAssignmentHistory.description: The Pay Rule Assignment History entity provides a historical record of the pay rules that have been assigned to an employee. Using its data columns you can create a Dataview or report that shows each pay rule that is assigned to an employee during a selected time period. The Pay Rule Assignment History entity and associated data columns are not related to transactional data columns and support only an audit of an employee's assigned pay rules.
payRuleAssignmentHistory.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per assigned pay rule.

columns.label: Pay Rule Effective Date (History)
columns.description: Effective date of the pay rule assigned to the employee currently or previously based on the selected date range

columns.label: Pay Rule Expiration Date (History)
columns.description: Expiration date of the pay rule assigned to the employee currently or previously based on the selected date range

columns.label: Pay Rule Name (History)
columns.description: Name of the pay rule assigned to the employee currently or previously based on the selected date range

paycode.name: Paycode
paycode.description: The Paycode entity provides data columns related to the paycodes configured in the application. The Paycode entity provides all of the attributes of the defined paycodes, including the name, type, and unit (Hours, Money, or Days).
paycode.dataGranularity: N/A - Paycode is a core entity and provides only dimensional data.

columns.label: Paycode ID
columns.description: The numeric identifier assigned to a paycode by the system

paycodeEdit.name: Paycode Edit
paycodeEdit.description: The Paycode Edit entity provides transactional data related to actual paycode edits that were made to an employee's timecard.
paycodeEdit.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per actual paycode edit transaction.

columns.label: Apply Date
columns.description: The date in the Timecard that the Paycode Edit was added

columns.label: Comments Indicator
columns.description: Whether or not there are comments added to the Paycode Edit

columns.label: Duration (Days)
columns.description: The number of days the Paycode Edit is for. This only applies to DURATION DAY based Paycodes

columns.label: Duration (Hours)
columns.description: The number of hours the Paycode Edit is for. This only applies to DURATION HOURS based Paycodes

columns.label: Money Amount
columns.description: The dollar value of the Paycode Edit. This only applies to MONEY based Paycodes

columns.label: System Generated Indicator
columns.description: Is the Paycode Edit system generated

paycodeEditComments.name: Paycode Edit Comments
paycodeEditComments.description: The Paycode Edit Comments entity provides the data columns necessary to view any comments that are applied to a paycode edit that provide additional information about the transaction.
paycodeEditComments.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per paycode edit comment.

planVolume.name: Plan Volume
planVolume.description:
The Plan Volume entity provides two columns, plan volume date and version, which provide the date and version of the planned volume data that has been entered in or imported to Workload Planner. Always use the Plan Volume entity in conjunction with the Plan Volume Detail entity and either the Plan Volume Detail — Schedule Zone or Plan Volume Detail — Standard Shift entity. Using data columns from these entities together will provide planned volume data by date, location in the Business Structure, and schedule zone or shift set.

Data is supplied for all dates in each schedule period. Version provides the latest version number for which volume is created in Workload Planner.
planVolume.dataGranularity: Provides one row per date per location (above Job) in the Business Structure per schedule zone or shift set within a defined schedule period.

columns.label: Plan Volume Location Name (Path)
columns.description: Location Name (Path) for which Plan Volume has been returned

planVolume.additionalInfo: If a location has assigned schedule zones, values will be provided in the schedule zone entity data columns. If a location has assigned standard shifts, values will be provided in the standard shift entity data columns. If a location has both standard shifts and schedule zones assigned, values will be provided only in the standard shift entity data columns.

planVolumeScheduleZone.name: Plan Volume - Schedule Zone
planVolumeScheduleZone.description:
The Plan Volume - Schedule Zone entity provides the zone details for planned volume data that is present in Workload Planner.

Because the Plan Volume - Schedule Zone entity does not have a relationship with the Plan Volume Detail entity that stores the planned volume value, it is recommended that you use the Plan Volume Detail - Schedule Zone entity instead.
planVolumeScheduleZone.dataGranularity: Provides many rows per location (above Jobs) in the Business Structure.

planVolumeScheduleZoneSet.name: Plan Volume - Schedule Zone Set
planVolumeScheduleZoneSet.description:
The Plan Volume - Schedule Zone Set entity provides the schedule zone set that is assigned to a location in the workload set up. 

"Note": Because volume is created only for locations above Job in the Workload Planner, the Plan Volume - Schedule Zone Set entity can be used only for locations above Job (for example, Department) in Workload Planner.
planVolumeScheduleZoneSet.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location above Job in the Business Structure.
planVolumeScheduleZoneSet.additionalInfo: A schedule zone set can contain multiple schedule zones that have been defined for a location. Schedule zones within the schedule zone set have exclusive start and end times. A schedule zone set cannot exceed 24 hours in length.

planVolumeStandardShift.name: Plan Volume - Standard Shift
planVolumeStandardShift.description:
The Plan Volume - Standard Shift entity provides the standard shifts for the planned volume data that is present in Workload Planner.

Because the Plan Volume - Standard Shift entity does not have a relationship with the Plan Volume Detail entity that stores the actual volume value, it is recommended that you use the Plan Volume Detail - Standard Shift entity instead.
planVolumeStandardShift.dataGranularity: Provides many rows per location (above Job) in the Business Structure.

planVolumeStandardShiftSet.name: Plan Volume - Standard Shift Set
planVolumeStandardShiftSet.description:
The Plan Volume — Standard Shift Set entity provides the standard shift set that is assigned to a location in the Business Structure.

"Note": Because volume is created only for locations above Job in Workload Planner, the Plan Volume — Standard Shift Set entity can be used only for locations above Job in the Business Structure.
planVolumeStandardShiftSet.dataGranularity: Provides many rows per location (above Job) in the Business Structure.
planVolumeStandardShiftSet.additionalInfo: A standard shift set can contain many standard shifts that have been defined for a location.

planVolumeDetail.name: Plan Volume Detail
planVolumeDetail.description: The Plan Volume Detail entity provides planned volume data. You should always use this entity along with the Plan Volume entity and either the Plan Volume Detail Schedule Zone or the Plan Volume Detail Standard Shift entity. Using them together will provide data in a schedule period for planned volume values by date, by location (above Job) in the Business Structure, and by either schedule zone or shift sets.
planVolumeDetail.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure per date per schedule zone or shift set.
additionalInfo: Plan Volume Detail data cannot be analyzed only by department or only by department and date because the current data model does not support aggregation at those levels. The planned volume detail data can be analyzed only by department, span (zone or shift name), and date. This is the granularity at which the data is provided
The planned data cannot be correlated with coverage scheduled count data, workload planned count data, or workload budgeted count data
If you plan to create a Dataview or report data object using plan volume detail, actual volume detail, and budget volume detail together, you must first disable the column relationship rules

planVolumeDetailScheduleZone.name: Plan Volume Detail - Schedule Zone
planVolumeDetailScheduleZone.description: The Plan Volume Detail - Schedule Zone entity provides the zone details for planned volume data that is present in Workload Planner. These can be analyzed by location (above Job) in the Business Structure.
planVolumeDetailScheduleZone.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure per schedule zone.
additionalInfo: If you plan to create a Dataview or report data object using plan volume detail, actual volume detail, and budget volume detail together by plan volume detail schedule zone, you must disable the column relationship rules

Because a schedule zone set can contain multiple schedule zones that have been defined for a location, the granularity of the data provided by the Plan Volume Detail — Schedule Zone entity is one row per location and schedule zone

planVolumeDetailStandardShift.name: Plan Volume Detail - Standard Shift
planVolumeDetailStandardShift.description: The Plan Volume Detail — Standard Shift entity provides the standard shift details for the planned volume data that is created in Workload Planner.. The planned volume data is created in the workload planner. These can be analyzed by location (above Job) in the Business Structure. (Volume is not created at the Job level).
planVolumeDetailStandardShift.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location (above Job) in the Business Structure and standard shift.
planVolumeDetailStandardShift.additionalInfo: If you plan to create a Dataview or report data object using plan volume detail, actual volume detail, and budget volume detail together by plan volume detail standard shift, you must disable the column relationship rules.

postedSchedule.name: Posted Schedule
postedSchedule.description: The Posted Schedule entity provides posted schedule information for a job for a given schedule period. Users can view information such as who posted the schedule, and the time period for which the schedule was posted. In addition users can view an indicator that shows if the schedule was unposted for the selected job and schedule period.
postedSchedule.dataGranularity: Provides one row per job and posted schedule period.
postedSchedule.additionalInfo: The data columns in the Posted Schedule entity can only return data at the Job level. The Scheduling domain stores the schedule posting information by job only.

primaryJobAssignmentHistory.name: Primary Job Assignment History
primaryJobAssignmentHistory.description: The Primary Job Assignment History entity provides a historical record of the primary jobs that have been assigned to an employee. Using its data columns you can create a Dataview or report that shows each primary job that is assigned to an employee during a selected time period. The Primary Job Assignment History entity and associated data columns are not related to transactional data columns and support only an audit of an employee's assigned primary jobs.
primaryJobAssignmentHistory.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per assigned primary job.

columns.label: Primary Job — Full Path (History)
columns.description: Full path of the primary job assigned to the employee currently or previously based on the selected date range

columns.label: Home Labor Category
columns.description: Full path of the home labor category assigned to the employee currently or previously based on the selected date range

columns.label: Primary Job Effective Date (History)
columns.description: Effective date of the primary job assigned to the employee currently or previously based on the selected date range

columns.label: Primary Job Expiration Date (History)
columns.description: Expiration date of the primary job assigned to the employee currently or previously based on the selected date range

columns.label: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Launch Date
columns.description: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Launch Date

columns.description: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Org Jobs

columns.description: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Procedure Set

columns.description: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Span End Date

columns.label: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Span Start Date
columns.description: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Span Start Date

columns.label: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit User
columns.description: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit User

columns.description: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Detail Initial Shift

columns.description: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Detail Employee

columns.description: .Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Detail Action Name

columns.label: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Detail Action Message
columns.description: Priority Scheduling Engine Audit Detail Action Message

projectedPaycodeTotalsCorrectionsOnly.name: Projected Paycode Totals - Corrections Only
projectedPaycodeTotalsCorrectionsOnly.description: The Projected Paycode Totals Corrections Only entity provides the total hours, wages or days related to a historical correction made during the selected time period for a selected pay code. When creating a Dataview, you can select the pay code for which totals data will be provided. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the hours for each employee that are related to the 'REGULAR' pay code and that were generated by a historical correction performed in the selected time period, configure the Paycode Total Projected Hours (Corrections Only) data column with an assignment value of 'REGULAR'.
projectedPaycodeTotalsCorrectionsOnly.dataGranularity: Provides one row per Employee. The data that is returned is summarized for the selected time period.
additionalInfo: When using the data columns in the Projected Paycode Totals Corrections Only entity, select the desired pay code from all available pay codes, including both Standard and Combined pay codes

When creating a Dataview, you can add the same data column from the Projected Paycode Totals Corrections Only entity multiple times, assigning a different pay code to each. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the actual hours that are related to the 'REGULAR' pay code and the "OVERTIME" pay code, you can add the Paycode Total Projected Hours (Corrections Only) data column twice, assigning the 'REGULAR' pay code to one column and the "OVERTIME" pay code to the other

You can use the data columns in the Projected Paycode Totals Corrections Only entity in conjunction with the data columns in the Actual Paycode Totals Corrections Only and the Scheduled Paycode Totals entities to view a comparison of Actual to Projected to Scheduled. To do this, you must disable the Column Relationship Rules in the Dataview and assign the same pay code to the selected data columns in these entities

projectedPaycodeTotalsExcludeCorrections.name: Projected Paycode Totals - Exclude Corrections
projectedPaycodeTotalsExcludeCorrections.description: The Projected Paycode Totals Exclude Corrections entity provides the total hours, wages, or days that are related to the selected time period for a selected pay code, minus any historical correction totals related to the selected time period. When creating a Dataview, you can select the pay code for which totals data will be provided. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the hours for each employee that are related to the 'REGULAR' pay code that apply to the selected time period (excluding historical corrections made in that period), configure the Paycode Total Projected Hours (Exclude Corrections) data column with an assignment value of 'REGULAR'.
projectedPaycodeTotalsExcludeCorrections.dataGranularity: Provides one row per Employee. The data that is returned is summarized for the selected time period.
additionalInfo: When using the data columns in the Projected Paycode Totals Exclude Corrections entity, select the desired pay code from all available pay codes, including both Standard and Combined pay codes

When creating a Dataview, you can add the same data column from the Projected Paycode Totals Exclude Corrections entity multiple times, assigning a different pay code to each. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the actual hours that are related to the 'REGULAR' pay code and the "OVERTIME" pay code, you can add the Paycode Total Projected Hours (Exclude Corrections) data column twice, assigning the 'REGULAR' pay code to one column and the "OVERTIME" pay code to the other

You can use the data columns in the Projected Paycode Totals Exclude Corrections entity in conjunction with the data columns in the Actual Paycode Totals Exclude Corrections and the Scheduled Paycode Totals entities to view a comparison of Actual to Projected to Scheduled. To do this, you must disable the Column Relationship Rules in the Dataview and assign the same pay code to the selected data columns in these entities

projectedPaycodeTotalsIncludeCorrections.name: Projected Paycode Totals - Include Corrections
projectedPaycodeTotalsIncludeCorrections.description: The Projected Paycode Totals Include Corrections entity provides the total hours, wages, or days that are related to the selected time period for a selected pay code, including any historical correction totals related to the selected time period. When creating a Dataview, you can select the pay code for which totals data will be provided. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the hours for each employee related to the 'REGULAR' pay code that apply to the selected time period (including historical corrections made in that period), configure the Paycode Total Projected Hours (Include Corrections) data column with an assignment value of 'REGULAR'.
projectedPaycodeTotalsIncludeCorrections.dataGranularity: Provides one row per Employee. The data that is returned is summarized for the selected time period.
additionalInfo: When using the data columns in the Projected Paycode Totals Include Corrections entity, select the desired pay code from all available pay codes, including both Standard and Combined pay codes.

When creating a Dataview, you can add the same data column from the Projected Paycode Totals Include Corrections entity multiple times, assigning a different pay code to each. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the actual hours that are related to the 'REGULAR' pay code and the "OVERTIME" pay code, you can add the Paycode Total Projected Hours (Include Corrections) data column twice, assigning the 'REGULAR' pay code to one column and the "OVERTIME" pay code to the other

You can use the data columns in the Projected Paycode Totals Include Corrections entity in conjunction with the data columns in the Actual Paycode Totals Include Corrections and the Scheduled Paycode Totals entities to view a comparison of Actual to Projected to Scheduled. To do this, you must disable the Column Relationship Rules in the Dataview and assign the same pay code to the selected data columns in these entities

projectedTotalsCorrectionsOnly.name: Projected Totals - Corrections Only
projectedTotalsCorrectionsOnly.description: The Projected Totals Corrections Only entity provides the total hours, wages or days that are related to all Historical Correction transactions that were performed in the selected time period for all historical correction transactions that were performed in the selected time period.
projectedTotalsCorrectionsOnly.dataGranularity: The granularity is based on the selected summarization parameter value.

columns.label: Projected Total Labor Category Transfer Indicator

projectedTotalsExcludeCorrections.name: Projected Totals - Exclude Corrections
projectedTotalsExcludeCorrections.description: The Projected Totals Exclude Corrections entity provides the total hours, wages or days that are related to all Historical Correction transactions that were performed in the selected time period for all historical correction transactions that were performed in the selected time period.
projectedTotalsExcludeCorrections.dataGranularity: The granularity is based on the selected summarization parameter value.

columns.label: Projected Total Labor Category Transfer Indicator

projectedTotalsIncludeCorrections.name: Projected Totals - Include Corrections
projectedTotalsIncludeCorrections.description: The Projected Totals Include Corrections entity provides the total hours, wages or days that are related to all Historical Correction transactions that were performed in the selected time period for all historical correction transactions that were performed in the selected time period.
projectedTotalsIncludeCorrections.dataGranularity: The granularity is based on the selected summarization parameter value.

columns.label: Projected Total Labor Category Transfer Indicator

reviewerListAssignments.name: Reviewer List Assignments
reviewerListAssignments.description:
The Reviewer List Assignments entity provides data columns that allow the creation of Dataviews and Report Data Objects that provide information on all reviewer lists that are assigned to employees.

This entity is purely for reporting on the reviewer lists assigned to each employee. It is not intended to be used with transactional data.
reviewerListAssignments.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per reviewer list.

columns.label: Reviewer List Name
columns.description: Employee's assigned overtime approver

columns.label: Reviewer List Purpose
columns.description: Employee's assigned reviewer list purpose

scheduleAvailability.name: Schedule Availability
scheduleAvailability.description:
The Schedule Availability entity provides the version number and the date for which the availability is defined for employees. It returns the start and end times of the schedule segment for which availability is defined. The entity also provides audit information related to added, edited or deleted availability. For more information on analyzing Availability audit data, please see the Audit Availability entity.

Use the Schedule Availability entity with the Schedule Segment Availability entity for reporting and analysis. The Segment Start Time, Segment End Time, and Availability Type data columns exist only in the Schedule Segment Availability entity.

For more information on analyzing Availability audit data, see the Audit Availability entity.
scheduleAvailability.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per availability segment type per date.

scheduleCallLog.name: Schedule Call Log
scheduleCallLog.description: The Schedule Call log entity allows users to create a Dataview or report that returns information regarding outcomes (call log entries) that are associated with individual employees. This allows managers to track employee responses to outcomes such as offered shifts to ensure that company rules have been followed.
scheduleCallLog.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per outcome.

columns.description: Date and time of the call log entry

columns.label: Call Log Entry User
columns.description: Call log user

columns.label: Call Log Shift Start Date

columns.label: Call Log Source

scheduleDayLock.name: Schedule Day Lock
scheduleDayLock.description: The Schedule Day Lock entity provides the data related to locked shifts within the Schedule Planner.
scheduleDayLock.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per date.

scheduleEventShift.name: Schedule Event Shift
scheduleEventShift.description: The Schedule Event Shift entity provides the Shift Label data column for the shifts for which the employee is scheduled.

scheduleEvents.name: Schedule Events
scheduleEvents.description:
The Schedule Events entity provides information related to three different types of schedule events:

Scheduled Paycode Edit
Shift
Shift Segment

It provides all schedule-related events for an employee in the selected time period.
scheduleEvents.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per schedule event.

columns.label: Overlapping Span Type
columns.description: Type of span where the schedule event overlaps

scheduleEvents.additionalInfo: Use the Index data column to analyze the sequence of scheduled events for an employee in a schedule period.

scheduleEventsPaycodeEdit.name: Schedule Events Pay Code Edit
scheduleEventsPaycodeEdit.description: The Schedule Events Pay Code Edit entity provides scheduled pay code edit event-related information such as the pay code name and the amount of the scheduled pay code edit for an employee in a given time period.
scheduleEventsPaycodeEdit.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per scheduled pay code edit.

columns.label: Comments and Notes
columns.description: Combined list of comments and notes in a single column, including those for open shift segments

scheduleGroupAssignment.name: Schedule Group Assignment
scheduleGroupAssignment.description: The Schedule Group Assignment entity provides the information related to each employee's assigned schedule group.

scheduleMetricsLocation.name: Schedule Metrics (Location)
scheduleMetricsLocation.description: The Schedule Metrics (Location) entity provides data for location-based schedule metrics for use in Dataviews and reports.
scheduleMetricsLocation.dataGranularity: Provides one row per day and span per hours per volume type.

scheduleMetricsByDayLocation.name: Schedule Metrics by Day (Location)
scheduleMetricsByDayLocation.description: The Schedule Metrics by Day (Location) entity provides the data columns needed to show hours per volume or HPPD for a location. It includes columns that report the volume (census) for a location as well as the workload hours for each job in the location. It also provides the calculated hours per volume values.

scheduleMetricsBySpanJob.name: Schedule Metrics by Span (Job)
scheduleMetricsBySpanJob.description: The Schedule Metrics by Span (Job) entity provides the data columns needed to show workload hours by span for a job. The hours for each workload span are calculated by multiplying the headcount for each workload span by the duration of the span.

scheduleRuleOverrides.name: Schedule Rule Overrides
scheduleRuleOverrides.description: The Schedule Rule Overrides entity provides the information related to schedule rule overrides assigned to the employee, the override values, effective date and expiration dates.

columns.label: Schedule Rule Override Expiration Date

scheduleRuleViolations.name: Schedule Rule Violations
scheduleRuleViolations.description:
The Schedule Rule Violations entity allows managers to view all schedule rule violations for a location or group of employees. This will let managers evaluate how many of each type of violation are occurring, how many rule violations are unresolved, and which employees frequently have schedule rule violations.

When the Schedule Rule Violations entity is used in an Employee Dataview, only employee rule violations are returned. To obtain the employee data, use the columns provided in the Employee Details entity.

When the Schedule Rule Violations entity is used in a Business Structure Dataview, both employee and organizational rule violations are included. You can use certain data columns from the Employee Details entity in the Business Structure or Business Structure Time Series Dataview to identify employees. Use the Rule Violation Location column to report the location of the org rule violation. Note that employee rule violations have no jobs or locations associated with them in a Business Structure Dataview.
scheduleRuleViolations.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee or location/job per rule violation.

columns.label: Rule Violation Date
columns.description: Date associated with the rule violation

columns.label: Rule Violation Description
columns.description: Description of the rule violation

columns.label: Rule Violation Location
columns.description: Full path to location associated with violation

columns.label: Rule Violation Name
columns.description: Name of the rule violation

columns.label: Rule Violation Severity
columns.description: Severity of the rule violation

columns.label: Rule Violation Type
columns.description: Type of the rule violation

scheduleRuleViolations.additionalInfo: Columns defined in the Schedule Rule Violations entity can be used in either an Employee or Business Structure Dataview, but an Employee Dataview will not include organizational rule violations.

scheduleSegmentAvailability.name: Schedule Segment Availability
scheduleSegmentAvailability.description: The Schedule Segment Availability entity provides information about an employee"s availability for the different types of availability segments (Unavailable, Available, Preferred, and Preferred Time Off) for a selected date. Each employee"s availability segment for a given time period has a start time and an end time. The entity also provides audit information related to added, edited, or deleted availability. Because the Schedule Availability entity provides the necessary date column, you should always use the Schedule Segment Availability entity together with the Schedule Availability entity.
scheduleSegmentAvailability.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per availability segment type per day.

scheduleSummary.name: Schedule Summary
scheduleSummary.description: The Schedule Summary entity provides data on the total number of scheduled hours per week.

columns.label: Scheduled Weekly Hours
columns.description: The total number of scheduled hours per week

scheduleTag.name: Schedule Tag
scheduleTag.description:
Schedule tags can be defined in the system to be applied to scheduling hours, such as on-call and training hours. Managers can schedule the time for an employee in Schedule Planner using a defined schedule tag. Each schedule tag has a default start time and end time which can be overridden by managers when they assign the schedule tag in Schedule Planner.

The Schedule Tag entity provides the overridden values for the start and end time of the employee's schedule.
scheduleTag.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per scheduled shift to which a schedule tag has been applied.
scheduleTag.additionalInfo: The data found in this entity belongs to the Schedule tag type only.

scheduleTagSegment.name: Schedule Tag Segment
scheduleTagSegment.description: The Schedule Tag Segment entity provides information for schedules added by means of a schedule tag in Schedule Planner. It provides information such as the definition of the schedule tag, the color of the schedule tag, the full path of the scheduled job, and the scheduled labor category.
scheduleTagSegment.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per scheduled shift to which a schedule tag has been applied.
scheduleTagSegment.additionalInfo: The data found in this entity belongs to the Schedule tag type only.

scheduleZone.name: Schedule Zone
scheduleZone.description:
Users can configure different schedule zones with a defined start time and end time within a 24-hour period. These start and end times cannot overlap.  Schedule zones can be used to define a schedule zone set that can be assigned to a location node in the Business Structure. The child locations within that assigned location inherit their parent location's schedule zone set.

The Schedule Zone entity provides the zone name, the zone description, and the zone start and end times for a location for a selected time period.
scheduleZone.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location per schedule zone.
scheduleZone.additionalInfo: Use the Schedule Zone entity to analyze coverage by scheduled count, budgeted count, and planned count by zones and dates.

scheduleZoneSet.name: Schedule Zone Set
scheduleZoneSet.description:
You can configure a schedule zone set with multiple schedule zones. You can then assign a schedule zone set to a location node in the Business Structure. The child locations within that assigned location inherit their parent location's schedule zone set.

The Schedule Zone Set entity provides the data columns necessary to display a location's assigned schedule zone set. Use the Schedule Zone Set entity to report on and analyze coverage and workload.
scheduleZoneSet.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location per schedule zone set.

scheduleZoneSetAssignment.name: Schedule Zone Set Assignment
scheduleZoneSetAssignment.description:
You can configure a schedule zone set with multiple schedule zones. You can the assign the schedule zone set to a location node in the Business Structure. The child locations within that assigned location inherit their parent location's schedule zone set.

The Schedule Zone Set Assignment entity provides the effective dates of each location's assigned schedule zone set.
scheduleZoneSetAssignment.dataGranularity: Provides dimensional data that describes a defined Schedule Zone Set.

scheduledPaycodeEdit.name: Scheduled Paycode Edit
scheduledPaycodeEdit.description: The Scheduled Paycode Edit entity provides transactional data related to scheduled paycode edits.
scheduledPaycodeEdit.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per scheduled paycode edit.

scheduledPaycodeTotals.name: Scheduled Paycode Totals
scheduledPaycodeTotals.description: The Scheduled Paycode Totals entity provides the total scheduled hours, wages, or days that related to the selected time period for a selected pay code. When creating a Dataview, you can select the pay code for which totals data will be provided. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the hours for each employee related to the 'REGULAR' pay code that apply to the selected time period, configure the Paycode Total Scheduled Hours data column with an assignment value of 'REGULAR'.
scheduledPaycodeTotals.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee. The data that is returned is summarized for the selected time period.
additionalInfo: When using the data columns in the Scheduled Paycode Totals Include Corrections, select the desired pay code from all available pay codes, including both Standard and Combined pay codes

When creating a Dataview, you can add the same data column from this entity multiple times, assigning a different pay code to each data column added. For example, to create a Dataview that shows the actual hours related to the 'REGULAR' pay code and the "OVERTIME" pay code, you can add the Paycode Total Scheduled Hours (Include Corrections) data column twice, assigning the 'REGULAR' pay code to one column and the "OVERTIME" pay code to the other

You can use the data columns in the Scheduled Paycode Totals entity in conjunction with the data columns in the Actual Paycode Totals Corrections and the Projected Paycode Totals Corrections entities to view a comparison of Actual to Projected to Scheduled. To do this, you must disable the Column Relationship Rules in the Dataview and assign the same pay code to the selected data columns in these entities

scheduledShift.name: Scheduled Shift
scheduledShift.description: The Scheduled Shift entity provides the scheduled shift details for an employee. Using the Scheduled Shift entity, a manager can view employees' scheduled shift start time and end time and determine if the scheduled shift was posted or generated.
scheduledShift.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per scheduled shift. When no segment-specific columns have been added to the Dataview or report from the Schedule Shift entity, the individual Comments column and Notes column can be used. In that case, granularity will be one row per comment/note combination assigned to the shift.

columns.label: Comments
columns.description: Comment added to the shift

columns.description: Combined list of comments and notes in a single column

columns.label: Locked Shift Indicator
columns.description: Locked Shift Indicator

scheduledShiftSegment.name: Scheduled Shift Segment
scheduledShiftSegment.description: The Scheduled Shift Segment entity provides the scheduled shift segment details for an employee. Using this entity, a manager can analyze employees' scheduled shift segments (regular, transfers, and breaks), scheduled job, and scheduled labor categories in a defined time period.
scheduledShiftSegment.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per scheduled shift segment.
scheduledShiftSegment.additionalInfo: Each scheduled shift segment can have a scheduled job transfer or a scheduled labor category transfer for the employee. Use the Scheduled Job and Scheduled Labor Category data columns in the Scheduled Shift Segment entity to examine this information.

scheduledShiftSegmentScProfile.name: Scheduled Shift Segment S&C Profile
scheduledShiftSegmentScProfile.description: The Scheduled Shift Segment S&C Profile entity provides the skill and certification profiles for the scheduled shift segment profile. Using the Skill and Certification Profile column in this entity along with the columns in the Employee Details and Scheduled Shift Segment entities, a manager can list the profiles for employees who have been assigned scheduled shift segments.
scheduledShiftSegmentScProfile.dataGranularity: Provides one row per skill and certification profile per employee per scheduled shift segment.

scheduledTotals.name: Scheduled Totals
scheduledTotals.description: The Scheduled Totals entity provides the total scheduled hours, wages, or days related to the selected time period.
scheduledTotals.dataGranularity: The granularity is based on the selected summarization parameter value.

selfScheduleRequest.name: Self Schedule Request
selfScheduleRequest.description:
The Self-Schedule Request entity provides data that enables you to create Dataviews and reports that can be used to review self-schedule requests that are made by employees. This data allows managers to determine the number of requests, which employees are or are not regularly self-scheduling, and how many shifts are being self-scheduled.

Use the columns in the Employee Details entity along with those in the Self Schedule Request entity to view data columns associated with the employee that is related to the self-schedule request.

Note that the selected time frame is used to bring up requests based on either of the shift dateincluded in the request, and not the date of the request.

selfScheduleRequestStatusHistory.name: Self Schedule Request Status History
selfScheduleRequestStatusHistory.description:
The Self-Schedule Request Status History entity allows a user to see the path that a self-schedule request has taken through the approval process, such as who has changed the status of a request and when that status was changed.

Use the columns in the Employee Details entity along with those in the Self Schedule Request Status History entity to view data columns associated with the employee that is related to the request.
selfScheduleRequestStatusHistory.dataGranularity: One row per employee per request item per status change.

columns.description: System identifier of the self-schedule request

columns.label: Self-schedule Request Status Change Date

columns.label: Self-schedule Request Status Change User
columns.description: Name of the user who modified the status of the self-schedule request

columns.description: Status of the self-schedule request before the change was made by the user

columns.label: Self-schedule Request Status Changed To
columns.description: Status of the self-schedule request after the change was made by the user

selfScheduleRequestStatusHistory.additionalInfo: The Self Schedule Request Status History entity does not have a relationship with the Self Schedule Request entity because the entities provide the data at different levels of granularity. If the Column Relationship Rules are enabled and the user selects a column from the Self Schedule Request Status History entity, the user cannot add columns from the Self Schedule Request entity.

shiftSegmentTag.name: Shift Segment Tag
shiftSegmentTag.description: The Shift Segment Tag entity provides the definition and color of each schedule segment tag that is configured in the system. A user can associate a schedule shift segment with a schedule segment tag in the schedule planner. You should always use the Shift Segment Tag entity entity with the Scheduled Shift Segment entity.
shiftSegmentTag.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per scheduled shift segment start time and shift segment end time.

signOff.name: Sign Off
signOff.description: The Sign Off entity provides the data columns necessary to understand the status of, date of, and manager who performed the most recent sign-off action.
signOff.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per signed-off pay period.
additionalInfo: The Sign Off Date column provides the date of the most recent sign-off that was applied to the employee's timecard
The Signed Off Indicator column and Previous Period Signed Off Indicator column are based on the selected time period or date range of the executed Dataview

swapRequest.name: Swap Request
swapRequest.description:
The Swap Request entity provides data that enables you to create Dataviews and reports that can be used to review swap requests that are made by employees. This data allows you to determine the number of requests, which employees are making the requests, and the status of the requests. Given this information managers can better ensure that swap requests are being approved or rejected in a timely manner, learn which employees are or are not regularly requesting other employees to swap their shifts, and see whether swap requests are being accepted or rejected by other employees.

Use the columns in the [Employee Details](./employee-details) entity along with those in the Swap Request entity to view data columns associated with the employee that is related to the swap request.

Note that the selected time frame is used to bring up requests based on either of the shift dates included in the request, and not the creation date of the request.
swapRequest.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per swap shift request item segment and recipient.

targetHours.name: Target Hours
targetHours.description:
The Target Hours entity provides data related to the use of the target hours, or averaging, functionality. Target hours allow managers to see the variance between the target hours as defined in an employee's Employment Terms and the actual hours that the employee worked.

The data columns in the Target Hours entity provide the same data that is available through the Target Hours add-on available in the timecard editor.
targetHours.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per work hours definition in the employee's assigned Employment Terms.

timecardChanges.name: Timecard Changes
timecardChanges.description: The Timecard Changes entity allows a user to configure a Dataview or report that allows the payroll administrator to view information about the pending timecard change requests in the selected timeframe.
timecardChanges.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per timecard change per date.

timecardChanges.additionalInfo: This entity provides the changes that are requested by the employee in their Timecard. The Function Access Profile control point Employee > Timecard Editor for Employees (My Timecard) > "Automatically submit Timecard edits for manager approval" must be enabled for data to appear in this entity.

timecardTransactions.name: Timecard Transactions
timecardTransactions.description:
The Timecard Transactions entity provides detailed data related to each timekeeping transaction. It provides a row for each employee and each day, for all types of timecard transactions, such as Worked Shift Segment, Paycode Edit, Absence Exception, Historical Correction, and Hours Worked, and Overtime Approvals.

The Timecard Transactions entity enables a manager to view the actual duration and wages related to a timecard transaction. In addition, it makes available the paycode name and associated comments that are related to the transaction. You can also view the data in the Timecard Transactions entity by worked job or worked labor category when it is used with the Worked Job and Labor Category entity, respectively. It also allows you to see the in and out punches for a shift along with geolocation details related to each punch.
timecardTransactions.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per timecard transaction type per date.

columns.description: The name of the Known Place (when the out punch is determined to be inside a Known Place)

columns.label: Out Punch Latitude
columns.description: The latitude of an employee's out punch

columns.label: Out Punch Outside of Geofence
columns.description: Indicates if the employee's out punch was outside or inside the defined geofence

columns.label: Out Punch QR Code
columns.description: The name of the QR Code (when the out punch “Geofence Method” == “QR Code”)

columns.label: Out Punch WiFi Access
columns.description: The name of the WiFi Access Point (when the out punch “Geofence Method” == “WiFi”)

columns.label: Out Punch WiFi Network
columns.description: The name of the WiFi Network (when the out punch “Geofence Method” == “WiFi”)

columns.label: Reviewed Date
columns.description: Date in which the Timecard Transaction was performed

columns.label: Reviewer Name
columns.description: Name of person who reviewed the Timecard Transaction

columns.label: Start Date Time (Rounded)
columns.description: The rounded date and time of the employee's in punch

columns.label: Start Time
columns.description: Start Time of the Timecard Transaction

columns.label: Start Time (Rounded)
columns.description: The rounded time of the employee's in punch

columns.label: Wage Paycode Name
columns.description: The name of the Wage Paycode associated with the transaction

additionalInfo: The Timecard Transactions entity provides two special Transaction Types named Raw Total and Raw Total by Calendar Day

The Raw Total transaction type returns the raw data generated by the Totalizer at the worked span level. The data is provided by Employee, Paycode, “Worked” Job, “Worked” Labor Category, and “Worked” Work Rule. The Raw Total by Calendar Day transaction type is similar, except that it splits totals for worked spans that cross midnight into separate totals and ignores the employee's assigned Pay Rule

timeOffRequest.name: Time-Off Request
timeOffRequest.description:
The Time-Off Request entity provides data columns for use in Employee Dataviews and reports to monitor and manage time-off requests. The information returned in these columns includes the number of time-off-requests, the IDs of the employees making each request, and the request status (as a means to determine whether managers are approving or rejecting requests).

Use the columns in the Employee Details entity along with those in the Time-Off Request entity to view data columns associated with the employee that is related to the time-off request.

Use the columns in the Paycode entity along with those in the Time-Off Request entity to view the pay code name and other attributes of the pay code that is associated with the time-off request.
timeOffRequest.dataGranularity: One row per employee, per time-off request item.

columns.label: Time-off Request Actors
columns.description: Names of the users who have approved or rejected the time-off request

columns.label: Time-off Request Creation Date
columns.description: Date and time that the time-off request was created and submitted by the employee

columns.label: Time-off Request Creator Full Name
columns.description: Full name of the user who created the time-off request

columns.label: Time-off Request Employee Comments & Notes
columns.description: List of the comments and associated notes that the employee has applied to the time-off request

columns.label: Time-off Request ID
columns.description: System identifier of the time-off request

columns.label: Time-off Request Item Duration
columns.description: The hours or days of requested time-off

columns.label: Time-off Request Item End Date
columns.description: End date and time of the requested time-off items

columns.label: Time-off Request Item Start Date
columns.description: Start date and time of the requested time-off items

columns.label: Time-off Request Manager Comments & Notes
columns.description: List of the comments and associated notes that a manager has applied to the time-off request

columns.label: Time-off Request Status
columns.description: Current status of the time-off "request": that is, the status of the request at the time that the Dataview or report is executed by a user

columns.label: Time-off Request Status Code
columns.description: Code representing the status of the time-off request

columns.label: Time-off Request Subtype Description
columns.description: Description of the time-off request subtype

columns.label: Time-off Request Subtype Name
columns.description: Name of the request subtype that is associated with the time-off request

columns.label: Time-off Request Subtype Symbol
columns.description: Symbol of the time-off request subtype

columns.label: Time-off Request Symbolic Amount
columns.description: Symbolic amount of the requested time-off

additionalInfo: The Time-Off Request entity does not have a relationship with the Time-Off Request Status History entity because the entities provide the data at different levels of granularity. If the Column Relationship Rules are enabled and the user selects a column from the Time-Off Request entity, the user cannot add columns from the Time-Off Request Status History entity
When a Dataview or report is executed for a selected time span, the Time-Off Request entity returns any request with dates that overlap that time span

timeOffRequestStatusHistory.name: Time-Off Request Status History
timeOffRequestStatusHistory.description:
The Time-Off Request Status History entity allows a user to see the path that a time-off request has taken through the approval process, such as who has changed the status of a request and when that status was changed.

Use the columns in the Employee Details entity along with those in the Time-Off Request Status History entity to view data columns associated with the employee that is related to the time-off request.
timeOffRequestStatusHistory.dataGranularity: One row per employee per time-off request status change.

columns.label: Time-off Request ID
columns.description: System identifier of the time-off request item

columns.label: Time-off Request Status Change Date
columns.description: Date and time that the status of a time-off request was changed

columns.label: Time-off Request Change User
columns.description: Name of the user who modified the status of a time-off request

columns.label: Time-off Request Changed From
columns.description: Status of a time-off request before it was modified

columns.label: Time-off Request Changed To
columns.description: Status of a time-off request after it was modified

timeOffRequestStatusHistory.additionalInfo: The Time-Off Request Status History entity does not have a relationship with the Time-Off Request entity because the entities provide the data at different levels of granularity. If the Column Relationship Rules are enabled and the user selects a column from the Time-Off Request Status History entity, the user cannot add columns from the Time-Off Request entity.

totalizationStatus.name: Totalization Status
totalizationStatus.description: The Totalization Status entity provides an employee's current status in relation to the totalization of any relevant transactions. The provided data columns can be used with nearly all other entities. When used with entities that return multiple rows per employee, the totalization status data will be the same for each row as it is related to the employee.

trafficPattern.name: Traffic Pattern
trafficPattern.description: The Traffic Pattern entity provides columns that can be used in Dataviews and Report Data Objects to supply details about the traffic patterns that are used by the Forecast Planner to distribute forecast labor in 15-minute intervals across a business day.
trafficPattern.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location or category and driver combination per day per 15-minute interval (96 rows per day).

columns.label: Traffic Pattern Date
columns.description: The date of a traffic pattern

columns.label: Traffic Pattern End Date Time
columns.description: The end date and time of a traffic pattern interval

columns.label: Traffic Pattern Location Path
columns.description: Full location path of the traffic pattern

columns.label: Traffic Pattern Start Date Time
columns.description: Start data and time of a traffic pattern interval. 15-minute

columns.label: Traffic Pattern Traffic Percent
columns.description: Percentage of traffic allocated to the specified interval

columns.label: Traffic Pattern Volume Driver
columns.description: Volume driver associated with the traffic pattern

volumeDetails.name: Volume Details
volumeDetails.dataGranularity: Provides one row per location or category and driver combination per day per 15-minute interval (96 rows per day).

columns.label: Volume Details Amount
columns.description:
The amount of volume for the interval

"Note": The Volume Details Amount column has a parameter to return either the forecasted volume or the actual volume

columns.label: Volume Details Date
columns.description: The date of a volume interval

columns.label: Volume Details End Date Time
columns.description: The end date and time of a volume interval

columns.label: Volume Details Location Path
columns.description: The full location path for a volume interval

columns.label: Volume Details Start Date Time
columns.description: The start date and time of a volume interval

columns.label: Volume Details Volume Driver
columns.description: The volume driver associated with a volume interval

workedJob.name: Worked Job
workedJob.description: The Worked Job entity provides the data columns necessary to understand the job an employee worked or was scheduled to work. This job may be different than the employee's primary job.
workedJob.dataGranularity: N/A - The Worked Job entity provides only dimensional data.

columns.label: Job Description — Full Path (Worked)
columns.description: Full path of the job to which actual, scheduled, or projected time is charged using the description of each location

columns.label: Job Full Name — Full Path (Worked)
columns.description: Full path of the job to which actual, scheduled, or projected time is charged using the full name of each location

columns.label: Job Name - Full Path (Worked)
columns.description: Full path of the job to which actual, scheduled, or projected time is charged

columns.label: Job Name (Worked)
columns.description: Name of the job to which actual, scheduled, or projected time is charged

columns.label: Location Description (Worked)
columns.description: Description of the worked location based on the selected location type

columns.label: Location Full Name (Worked)
columns.description: Full name of the worked location based on the selected location type

columns.label: Location Name (Worked)
columns.description: Name of the worked location based on the selected location type

workedShift.name: Worked Shift
workedShift.description:
The Worked Shift entity provides the start and end times of the actual shifts worked by employees. Data columns within the entity allow a user to determine if the shift is in progress and if the worked shift is from the employee's schedule.

To view the Actual Totals (hours, wages, or days) related to a worked shift, along with the actual in-punch and out-punch times, use the Timecard Transactions entity.
workedShift.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per worked shift.

columns.label: Worked Shift End Date Time (Rounded)
columns.description: The rounded date and time of the employee's out punch

columns.label: Worked Shift Start Date Time (Rounded)
columns.description: The rounded date and time of the employee's in punch

workedSpan.name: Worked Span
workedSpan.description:
The Worked Span entity provides the start and end times of the actual worked spans related to the employee's worked shifts. A worked shift may be broken into multiple spans depending on breaks and the crossing of the day divide. The Worked Span entity provides the data columns necessary to see the in and out times related to each span.

To view the Actual Totals (hours, wages, or days) related to a worked span, along with the actual in-punch and out-punch times, use the Timecard Transactions entity.

columns.label: Worked Span Work Rule Transfer Indicator

workedSpanInPunch.name: Worked Span In Punch
workedSpanInPunch.description: The Worked Span In Punch entity provides detailed information related to any in-punch. Use the Worked Span In Punch entity to view the date and time of an in-punch plus other elements related to the punch such as the data source, (such as clock or timecard), and an indication of whether comments have been applied to the punch.
workedSpanInPunch.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per in-punch.

columns.label: In Punch Date Time (Rounded)
columns.description: The rounded date and time of the employee's in punch

workedSpanOutPunch.name: Worked Span Out Punch
workedSpanOutPunch.description: The Worked Span Out Punch entity provides detailed information related to any out-punch. Use the Worked Span Out Punch entity to view the date and time of an out-punch plus other elements related to the punch such as the data source, (such as clock or timecard), and an indication of whether comments have been applied to the punch.
workedSpanOutPunch.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per out-punch.

columns.label: Out Punch Date Time (Rounded)
columns.description: The rounded date and time of the employee's in punch

workloadBudgetedCount.name: Workload - Budgeted Count
workloadBudgetedCount.description: The Workload - Budgeted Count entity provides the data for the budgeted employee count that is created in Workload Planner for a location. Its data columns can only be used with a Business Structure Dataview where the Location Type of the Dataview must be configured to “Job,” inasmuch as the data is provided only at the Job level and cannot be summarized at higher levels of the Business Structure.
workloadBudgetedCount.dataGranularity: Provides one row per job per date per span (schedule zone or shift set).

columns.label: Budgeted Count Job Group Name *
columns.description: The job group name for which the budgeted count has been returned

columns.label: Budgeted Count Span Name
columns.description: The span name for which the budgeted count has been returned

columns.label: Budgeted Count Span Type
columns.description: The span type for which the budgeted count has been returned

additionalInfo: Workload budget count data cannot be analyzed with volume entities because volume data is not present at the Job level and workload budget count data is not present at levels of an org that are higher than Job.
The columns marked with an asterisk return data to reports only when selected using a parameter in BIRT Designer. When selected for a Dataview, it does not return data

workloadPlannedCount.name: Workload - Planned Count
workloadPlannedCount.description: The Workload - Planned Count entity provides the data for planned employee count that is created in Workload Planner for a location. Its data columns can only be used with a Business Structure Dataview where the Location Type of the Dataview must be configured to “Job,” inasmuch as the data is provided only at the Job level and cannot be summarized at higher levels of the Business Structure.
workloadPlannedCount.dataGranularity: Provides one row per job per date per span (schedule zone or shift set).

columns.label: Planned Count Job Group Name *
columns.description: The job group name for which the planned count has been computed

columns.label: Planned Count Span Name
columns.description: The span name for which the planned count has been computed

columns.label: Planned Count Span Type
columns.description: The span type for which the planned count has been computed

additionalInfo: The Coverage - Scheduled Count entity allows users to analyze scheduled count with workload planned count and workload scheduled count by schedule zone, job, and date

Workload planned count data cannot be analyzed in partnership with the volume-focussed entities because volume data is not present at Job level in the Business Structure and the workload planned count data is not present above the Job level
The columns marked with an asterisk return data to reports only when selected using a parameter in BIRT Designer. When selected for a Dataview, it does not return data

workRuleOverride.name: Work Rule Override
workRuleOverride.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per work rule override.

hourlyWageRateHistory.name: Hourly Wage Rate History
hourlyWageRateHistory.description: The Hourly Wage Rate History entity provides a historical record of the base wages assigned to an employee. Using its data columns, you can create a Dataview or Report to show each base wage assigned to an employee during a selected time period. The Hourly Wage Rate History entity and associated data columns are not related to transactional data columns and support only an audit of an employee’s assigned base wages.
hourlyWageRateHistory.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per assigned base wage within the selected time period.

columns.label: Hourly Wage Rate (History)
columns.description: The value of the hourly wage rate assigned to the employee currently or previously based on the selected date range.

columns.label: Hourly Wage Rate Effective Date (History)
columns.description: The effective date of the hourly wage rate assigned to the employee currently or previously based on the selected date range.

columns.label: Hourly Wage Rate Expiration Date (History)
columns.description: The expiration date of the hourly wage rate assigned to the employee currently or previously based on the selected date range.

overtimeApprovalsSummary.name: Overtime Approvals Summary
overtimeApprovalsSummary.dataGranularity: Provides one row per employee per overtime approval summary record.
